summary:
Apple Working on a New Foldable iPad-Like Device Set for 2028 Release

Published on: December 17, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Apple is reportedly set to release a large foldable iPad-like device by 2028. Leaked information suggests the device could serve dual functions as either a Mac or an iPad.

  • The foldable device is expected to be 18.8 inches with an almost invisible crease.
  • Rumors of this product have been circulating, with various reports suggesting Apple aims to enter the foldable market.
  • Apple also plans to release OLED MacBook Pros in 2026 and an updated MacBook Air in 2027.
  • A foldable iPhone is also in development but is not expected to be released before 2026.
“Apple hasn't confirmed these reports yet.”

In conclusion, Apple’s advance into foldable technology with a potential release of a large foldable iPad device highlights its innovative trajectory in the tech space.
newTitle: Apple Working on a New Foldable iPad-Like Device Set for 2028 Release

title: India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 4 Live Score: Rain returns just after Ravindra Jadeja celebrates fifty - Hindustan Times
summary:
India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 4 Live Score: Rain returns just after Ravindra Jadeja celebrates fifty

Date: Dec 17, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

As the match progressed into Day 4, Ravindra Jadeja achieved his half-century, but heavy rain disrupted play shortly after. India was at 180/6 when the rain resumed, needing 65 runs to avoid the follow-on.

  • Ravindra Jadeja scores his 22nd Test fifty.
  • Rain delayed the start of the second session.
  • India's score was 167/7 at Lunch, trailing by 278 runs.
  • KL Rahul fell to Nathan Lyon on 94.
  • Partnership between KL Rahul and Ravindra Jadeja was significant, crossing 50 runs.
  • Only 33.1 overs were bowled on Day 3 due to rain interruptions.
"Jadeja has a very good record in Australia, averaging 54.00 in five Tests before this innings."

In conclusion, India faces considerable pressure as they attempt to avoid a follow-on while rain continues to hinder their performance.
newTitle: India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 4: Rain Interrupts Jadeja's Fifty Celebration

title: Delhi's air quality ‘severe’ at over 420 as GRAP 4 returns | Check area-wise AQI - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi AQI Today: The Union government's Centre for Air Quality Management on Monday decided to reimpose Stage 4 curbs under GRAP in the National Capital Region.

Date: Dec 17, 2024

Source: HT News Desk

Delhi faced 'severe' air quality levels today, with an AQI of 421 recorded in the morning. In response, the Centre for Air Quality Management has reimposed Stage 4 restrictions under GRAP due to the worsening situation.

  • The overall AQI in Delhi was 421 at 8 am.
  • Greater Noida recorded an AQI of 398, while Noida, Ghaziabad, and Gurugram had AQIs of 382, 380, and 356, respectively.
  • GRAP 4 restrictions include a ban on construction activities and limitations on polluting trucks entering Delhi.
“On December 5, the Supreme Court allowed the CAQM to relax the Stage 4 curbs… but the reimposition was necessary due to deteriorating AQI levels.”

The reimposition of restrictions aims to curb pollution in the National Capital Region as air quality continues to be a major concern.
newTitle: Delhi's Air Quality Hits 'Severe' Levels as GRAP 4 Restrictions Are Reimposed

title: With ‘One Nation, One Election’ Bills set to be tabled today, Congress issues whip to all Lok Sabha MPs - The Indian Express
summary:
Congress and Shiv Sena Whip Their MPs for ‘One Nation, One Election’ Bills in Lok Sabha

Publication Date: Tuesday

Source: Indian Express

The Congress and the Shiv Sena have issued whips mandating the presence of all their Lok Sabha MPs as significant bills for simultaneous elections to the Lok Sabha and state assemblies are set to be tabled in the Lower House today.

  • The Congress instructed its Lok Sabha members to attend crucial proceedings.
  • The Shiv Sena emphasized important legislative business to be discussed.
  • The 'One Nation, One Election' Bill is being introduced by Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal.
  • A Joint Committee of Parliament will be formed for wider consultations on the bill.
Of the 47 parties that submitted their opinion on the matter to the Kovind panel, 32 supported the idea and 15 opposed it.

This movement towards simultaneous elections could reshape the electoral landscape in India, with potential long-term consequences for political alignments.
newTitle: Congress and Shiv Sena Whip Their MPs for ‘One Nation, One Election’ Bills in Lok Sabha

HC grants anticipatory bail to Sushil Singhania in Atul Subhash suicide case - The Hindu
summary:
Atul Subhash suicide case: HC grants anticipatory bail to Nikita Singhania’s uncle Sushil Singhania

Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The Allahabad High Court has granted anticipatory bail to Sushil Singhania, the uncle of Nikita Singhania, in connection with the suicide case of AI engineer Atul Subhash. This hearing comes after multiple arrests were made related to the incident.

  • The court hearing was held before Justice Ashutosh Srivastava.
  • Nikita Singhania and her family have been accused of abetting Atul Subhash's suicide.
  • Sushil Singhania’s bail is based on concerns regarding a previous arrest and his medical condition.
“Considering the above, the court is of the opinion that applicant Sushil Singhania is entitled to get the privilege of pre-arrest (Transit) Anticipatory.”

The court also imposed conditions for Sushil Singhania's bail, including his availability for questioning by the police and restrictions on his travel.
newTitle: High Court Grants Anticipatory Bail to Sushil Singhania in Atul Subhash Suicide Case

title: ‘I Want To Kidnap You’: Uber Driver’s Text Leaves Gurugram Woman Terrified - News18
Jupiter's Hellish Moon Isn't Powered by a Hidden Ocean of Magma, Study Finds - ScienceAlert
summary:
Jupiter's Moon Io Powered by Localized Magma Chambers, Not a Global Ocean

Published on: October 2023, Source: Science Alert

New research indicates that the volcanic activity on Jupiter's moon Io is not driven by a hidden ocean of magma, as previously suggested. Instead, scientists have found that the volcanoes are fed by a network of small magma chambers within a primarily solid mantle.

  • The study used NASA's Juno spacecraft images and gravitational data.
  • It counters previous theories suggesting a global magma ocean under Io’s surface.
  • The findings have implications for understanding planetary formation and evolution.
  • Io's surface is covered with volcanic remnants from its numerous eruptions.
  • This research provides insights into tidal heating processes in celestial bodies.
“This constant flexing creates immense energy, which literally melts portions of Io's interior,” says Scott Bolton, a space physicist involved in the study.

The research highlights the complexity of tidal heating effects and broadens the understanding of volcanic processes on other celestial bodies.
newTitle: Jupiter's Moon Io Powered by Localized Magma Chambers, Not a Global Ocean

title: AR Rahman shares he, Zakir Hussain planned an album together: ‘I regret not being able to collaborate with him as much…’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
AR Rahman Mourns the Loss of Tabla Maestro Zakir Hussain

Date: Dec 17, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

AR Rahman paid tribute to the late Ustad Zakir Hussain, a renowned tabla maestro, expressing his grief and regret for not collaborating more during their careers.

  • Rahman shared images with Zakir on Instagram, showcasing his respect and sorrow through emojis.
  • He described Zakir's influence on music as immeasurable and celebrated his contributions to Indian classical music.
  • Rahman revealed plans for a collaborative album with Zakir, lamenting that they did not work together as much as they could have.
  • Zakir Hussain passed away in San Francisco at the age of 73 after battling a chronic lung disease.
  • Prime Minister Narendra Modi also mourned Zakir's death, highlighting his revolutionary impact on Indian classical music.
“Inna lillahi wa inna ilayhi raji'un. Zakir Bhai was an inspiration, a towering personality who elevated the tabla to global acclaim. His loss is immeasurable for all of us.” - AR Rahman

The music community remembers Zakir Hussain as a legend who transcended genres, leaving behind a legacy that will inspire future generations.
newTitle: AR Rahman Mourns the Loss of Tabla Maestro Zakir Hussain

title: Teacher, teenage student killed in a shooting at private Christian school in Wisconsin - Moneycontrol
Wisconsin school shooting: Suspect identified as gun-toting 17-year-old girl, police say it ‘truly is a sad day’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Wisconsin school shooting: Suspect identified as gun-toting 17-year-old girl, police say it ‘truly is a sad day’

Publication Date: Dec 17, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

On December 16, 2024, a shooting occurred at Abundant Life Christian School in Madison, Wisconsin, resulting in the deaths of two individuals and injuries to six others. The 17-year-old shooter was found dead at the scene.

  • The shooter allegedly killed a teacher and a student while injuring six more, two of whom are in life-threatening condition.
  • The police responded within three minutes of receiving a 911 call about an active shooter.
  • No prior connection to law enforcement or clear warning signs of violence were reported.
  • Authorities are still investigating the motive behind the shooting.
“Today truly is a sad day for Madison and for our country,” said Madison Police Chief Shon Barnes.

This tragic event has left the community in shock, and authorities are focusing on healing the emotional injuries sustained.
newTitle: Wisconsin School Shooting: 17-Year-Old Girl Suspect Identified

title: Apple’s reportedly working on a foldable iPhone as smartphone sellers try rebooting sales - Sherwood News
summary:
Apple’s Reportedly Working on a Foldable iPhone as Smartphone Sellers Try Rebooting Sales

Date: Tuesday, December 17, 2024

Source: Nia Warfield

Apple is planning to introduce foldable smartphone technology, including a potential iPhone with a larger display and a foldable laptop device, in an effort to revitalize sales and compete in an evolving market.

  • In the fold: Apple faces competition from Samsung's foldable devices, though recent sales have struggled.
  • Fold over: The foldable smartphone market saw a significant growth of 49% recently, influenced by new brands like Motorola and Huawei's impressive sales.

Not phoning it in: After a decline in sales, Apple announced a slight rebound in iPhone sales, but there are concerns that new models aren't meeting expectations.

More options can unlock more appeal: By expanding the range of products with varied designs and prices, Apple hopes to attract both current and potential customers.

Apple's proposed innovations could help the company regain momentum in a saturated smartphone market, hinting at a transformative phase in their product lineup.
newTitle: Apple’s Reportedly Developing a Foldable iPhone Amidst Market Challenges

Cold wave reaches Hyderabad, parts of North India shiver in below 0 deg C | Key points - Hindustan Times
summary:
Cold Wave Reaches Hyderabad, Parts of North India Shiver in Below 0 deg C

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A cold wave is affecting many regions in India, including Telangana and Hyderabad, where temperatures have dipped significantly. Major cities are recording temperatures significantly below normal, with several areas experiencing severe cold conditions.

  • Delhi's Cold Snap: Recorded a minimum temperature of 4.5°C, prompting the reimposition of GRAP 4 restrictions due to poor air quality.
  • Freezing Temperatures in Kashmir: Srinagar recorded temperatures as low as -3.4°C.
  • Impact in Rajasthan: Fatehpur in Sikar district recorded lows of -0.4°C.
  • Conditions in Telangana: Hyderabad saw temperatures drop to 6.4°C with similar trends across the region.
  • Warnings Issued: Severe cold warnings have been issued for multiple states, with predictions of ongoing cold conditions.
“The prediction indicates a continuation of cold conditions with further drops in minimum temperatures expected across the region.”

The ongoing cold wave is anticipated to have lasting effects on both health and economic aspects for the affected regions, with additional warnings forecasting continued colder temperatures in the upcoming days.
newTitle: Cold Wave Hits Hyderabad and Parts of North India

title: One nation, one election: Bill to hold simultaneous polls to be introduced in Lok Sabha today - Hindustan Times
summary:
One nation, one election: Bill to hold simultaneous polls to be introduced in Lok Sabha today

Date: Today Source: Hindustan Times

The Lok Sabha will discuss a constitutional amendment bill aimed at synchronizing Lok Sabha and assembly elections. This move seeks to streamline the election process across India.

  • The bill has been referred to as the Constitution (One Hundred and Twenty-Ninth Amendment) Bill, 2024.
  • Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal will introduce the bill in Parliament.
  • The bill proposes to amend Article 82(A) and other related articles to allow simultaneous elections.
  • Opposition parties are voicing strong concerns over the potential impact on democratic accountability and federalism.
  • Simultaneous elections are projected to begin in 2034.
“This impractical and anti-democratic move will erase regional voices, erode federalism, and disrupt governance.” – DMK Chief

The introduction of this bill reflects the government's effort to initiate significant electoral reforms while facing substantial opposition regarding its potential implications on democracy.
newTitle: Simultaneous Elections Bill to be Introduced in Lok Sabha

title: Naga Chaitanya says he tells Sobhita Dhulipala to speak with him in Telugu: ‘Just hearing that same texture…’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Naga Chaitanya Encourages Sobhita Dhulipala to Speak Telugu for Connection

Date: Dec 17, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Naga Chaitanya, who recently married Sobhita Dhulipala, shares his desire for her to speak to him in Telugu to improve his language skills and connect more deeply.

  • Naga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala got married on December 4 at Annapurna Studios in Hyderabad.
  • Chaitanya was born in Hyderabad but grew up in Chennai, speaking both Telugu and Tamil.
  • He expressed that speaking Telugu with Sobhita helps him feel a deeper connection.
  • The wedding showcased traditional Telugu customs, with Sobhita wearing a gold Kanjivaram saree.
  • Chaitanya was previously married to Samantha Ruth Prabhu, and they announced their separation in October 2021.
“In our industry we meet a variety of people from different languages. Just hearing that same texture [Telugu] and having that same warmth when you speak to someone- I think it just drew me closer so much faster.” - Naga Chaitanya

This insight highlights the personal connection that language can foster in relationships and reflects the rich cultural heritage shared by the couple.
newTitle: Naga Chaitanya Encourages Sobhita Dhulipala to Speak Telugu for Connection
